author: Omar Rashid
text:
BJP president Amit Shah on Wednesday urged the youth to follow the ideals of Dalit leader Raja Suhledev.

Over the years, the BJP and the RSS have tried to portray Raja Suheldev, a Pasi king, as a Hindutva warrior who stopped the march of Muslim invader Ghazi Mian, a nephew of Mahmud Ghazni, in Bahraich and halted Islamisation of the region.

After unveiling a statue of Suheldev and releasing a book on him, Mr. Shah urged the youth to take Suheldev as an “inspiration” and his conquest as a “message” on how the battle for independence could be fought.

“Only those who take inspiration from their ancestors and carry on with their fight can make history,” he said.
title: Amit Shah tells youth to draw inspiration from Dalit king’s legacy
